result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Frank Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No alcohol.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription. No association with known drug users or dealers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Pay all supervision fees, to make regular payments.
Any programing ordered by agent.
AODA assesment. Comply with any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Frank Phillips

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew Frank Phillips in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Defendant Andrew Phillips, in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS, CONCURRENT to 13CF4694, with credit for 118  DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.
- Seek and maintain full time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.
- Any programming ordered by agent.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Received and filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  All other conditions remain as stated previously.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Defendant Andrew Frank Phillips in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Defendant Andrew Frank Phillips in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was brought over from MSDF and was not booked in time that the deputies checked this morning.  Clerk contacted attorney Ahmad who is able to return to proceed with the plea.  Court proceeds with plea hearing today.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 12/15/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Munjed A. Ahmad in court, defendant Andrew Frank Phillips not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant not produced.  State did do an order to produce the defendant for today's date, and will try to see where the breakdown occured.  Case adjourned for plea hearing on 10/16/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw

Received and filed.

Count 1:  Possession with intent to deliver cocaine, contary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(1m)(cm)1r, 939.50(3)(f).  A class F felony.

Attorney Munjed A. Ahmad in court, defendant Andrew Frank Phillips not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense advised the court that defendant is requesting a plea date prior to the trial date.  Request is granted by the court.  The trial date shall remain on the calendar until the plea is taken,    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 03  Plea hearing scheduled for 10-10-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Frank Phillips in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel needs more time to talk with client.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 9/22/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Frank Phillips in court with attorney Munjed A Ahmad.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel states he will not be getting DNA tested, and has no other motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 8/18/2014 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 10/20/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Frank Phillips in court with attorney Jeff Guerard for attorney Munjed A Ahmad.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs the court that it would take about 120 days to have the DNA retested.  Court requests more information.  Case adjourned for status on 6/5/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Status conference scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Frank Phillips in court with attorney Munjed A Ahmad.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs the court that can get the baggies swabbed for DNA, but the concentration would be lower.  Defendant wants the baggies retested.  Case adjourned for status to see how long it will take to have baggies tested, on 6/2/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons.

Defendant Andrew Frank Phillips in court with attorney Munjed A Ahmad.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defendant wants to test the DNA privately.  State to investigate.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/13/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Frank Phillips in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel requests more time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/25/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Andrew Frank Phillips in court with attorney Jeff Guerard for Munjed A. Ahmad.  Hanna Kolberg for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is reassigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney. 
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Frank Phillips in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3-19-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
